intro: Ceranthera densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces showy, spurred orchid flowers that are typically 2–3 inches long. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
